intro: Scorzonera roylei, commonly known as the Persian scabious, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, aiding in water retention. Scorzonera roylei is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
